intro: Sida similis, commonly known as the slender sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, five-petaled flowers. It typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. Sida similis is an annual herb that produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds.
